intro: Eudoxia, commonly known as the frost flower, is a rare and delicate plant that thrives in cold climates. It is characterized by its unique, ice-like formations that appear on the surface of its stems during freezing conditions. The plant belongs to the genus Euphorbia and is native to the Arctic and alpine regions. Its botanical features include a low-growing structure with small, hairy leaves and yellowish flowers. Eudoxia is often found in rocky or sandy soils, where it adapts to harsh environmental conditions.
